fields.name: validateAddress
fields.description:
***【接口权限: 普通登录用户】***  
  验证地址，有三种返回结果

1. isValidAddress = true，地址验证通过，可直接请求 createAddress 接口保存

2. isValidAddress = false, newAddress = [], 地址验证不通过，且无法给出推荐地址，表示这个地址很可能是一个错的比较厉害的地址，比如 state 和 city 完全不匹配，此时应提示用户无法保存，需要重新输入

3. isValidAddress = false, newAddress = [{...suggestAddress}]，地址验证不通过，且有推荐地址返回，表示这个地址可能有一些错误，如 city 和 zipcode 不能完全匹配，此时应给用户展示推荐地址列表，让用户选择一个

每次重新调用 `appBatchCreateLiveProducts` 后，此接口数据会被替换。

此接口不分页。

When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: edited
fields.description:
从小店商品 Product 同步过来时，是否已编辑过。

调用 appCreateLiveProduct 创建的商品和调用过 appUpdateLiveProduct 修改的商品，都会被标记为已编辑过。

appBatchCreateLiveProducts 接口每次都会清空原直播商品编辑临时数据，重新创建直播商品。但标记已编辑过的商品，如果在调用 appBatchCreateLiveProducts 时在参数里将 id 传过来了，则不会重新创建，会保留原编辑的信息。

fields.name: agoraLiveToken
fields.description:
声网发流使用的 token。

请求 getLiveToken 接口后，此处的 token 会更新。请求 createLive 后，此处的 token 会自动更新。

不同人请求拿到的 token 不一样，主播请求显示的是主播使用的 token，连麦者请求后显示的是连麦者使用的 token。如果结果为 null，需要请求 getLiveToken 获取新的 token

根据 user.recentBroadcast（最近一次查询的广播id）,

types.name: UnionOrderModel
types.description:
SellingOrderModel 和 BuyingOrderModel 的区别

1. SellingOrderModel 多了如下字段：
```
- buyer
- salePrice
- transactionFeeRate
- transactionFeeTotalPrice
```
2. BuyingOrderModel 多了如下字段：
```
- seller
```
3. 同一订单，二者 `paidPrice` 的值不同
4. 同一订单，二者 `store` 字段结构不同
5. 同一订单，二者 `payment` 字段结构不同，buyer 能拿到更多错误信息

types.name: TimelineItem
types.description:
Timeline 表示整个时间轴对象，时间轴上每行信息（每条事件）叫 TimelineItem，关系为：Timeline = [TimelineItem] TimelineItem 主要由文本构成，也可掺杂一些 UI形式上、交互上较为复杂的元素，比如 button、user profile 等，举例如下: 1. `$xxx was added to ezze's Stripe account` --- 这是一条简单的文本 TimelineItem
2. `Order confirmation email was sent to {{Seller}}` --- `{{}}` 里包裹的部分，是一个需要用黄色强调展示的文本，点击文本可以跳到对应 Seller 主页 上述效果无法用简单的 html 富文本来实现，故设计上将一条 TimelineItem 记录从左到右用一个 contents 数组来描述，数组的元素 TimelineContentItem 可能是：文本、用户（含头像框、用户名等）、Button、Popup 等，以后如果添加新的 UI，就增加新的类型。

args.name: banItems
args.description:
封禁项目

**参数名**表示封禁项目。

**参数值**表示封禁时间，单位为秒。

参数值传 -1 表示永久封禁；传 0 表示取消封禁；其它值表示该帐号的具体禁言时间，除 -1 外的负值为非法值

args.description: 当 type 为 BLANK 时才可为空

args.name: position
args.description:
排序权重, 1-10. 编号 1 表示排第一位，2 表示第二位，以此类推

需求上 app 只能展示 10 个 banner，新创建 banner 时，如果设置 position 和原有 banner position 冲突。
新的 banner 会替代原 banner 的位置，原 banner 及后续 banner 全部往后顺延 1 位。

超过 10 个 banner 则排在 10 位以后的 banner 被删除

fields.name: appBatchCreateLiveProducts
fields.description:
***【接口权限: 普通登录用户】***  
  开带货 live 前从 Store Products 中选取商品创建 Live Products，此接口可多次重复请求。

为简化 app 端交互，不提供主动删除已创建的 Live Products 接口，每次重新传入 Store Products 时，
后端做一次 diff 操作，删去不需要的 products，创建新选取的 products。

此接口返回结果是本次 diff 后新创建的商品，而不是所有商品。如果用于展示，请勿依赖此接口返回结果

inputFields.name: active
inputFields.description:
**true 活跃主动**
当用户调用 getUnreadNotificationCount 接口时,
根据 user.recentBroadcast（最近一次查询的广播id）,
查询所有大于该 id 的广播（活跃主动）,
写入到通知表中，并将最新一条广播 id 更新到 user.recentBroadcast

**false 不活跃的**
不会自动写入 Notification 表,
需要触发某个事件或调用某个接口，触发写入

types.name: updateCardInput
types.description: card 存储于 stripe，stripe 只允许更新 expiryDate 和 billingAddress

enumValues.name: CANCEL_REQUEST_JOIN_BROADCASTER
enumValues.description: 观众请求加入连麦后，取消加入连麦的请求
enumValues.deprecationReason: 20220308 需求变化，观众无法主动取消请求，所以不会有此事件。客户端暂无需上报此事件

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED_JOIN_BROADCASTER
enumValues.description:
需要发送此事件的情况：
case 1. 观众请求加入连麦，主播**接受**观众连麦请求
case 2. 主播邀请观众连麦，观众**接受**主播邀请连麦

enumValues.name: DECLINE_JOIN_BROADCASTER
enumValues.description:
需要发送此事件的情况：
case 1. 观众请求加入连麦，主播**拒绝**观众连麦请求
case 2. 观众请求加入连麦，主播接受观众连麦请求后，观众**拒绝**加入连麦
case 3. 主播邀请观众连麦，观众**拒绝**邀请连麦

enumValues.name: INVITE_JOIN_BROADCASTER
enumValues.description: 主播邀请用户加入连麦

enumValues.name: CANCEL_INVITE_JOIN_BROADCASTER
enumValues.description: 主播取消邀请用户加入连麦

enumValues.name: STOP_JOIN_BROADCASTING
enumValues.description:
断开连麦。需要发送此事件的情况：
case 1. 用户主动断开连麦，用户发
case 2. 主播主动断开和用户连麦，主播发

fields.name: oauthPayload
fields.description: 不同第三方返回的结果信息

fields.name: iss
fields.description:
The Issuer Identifier for the Issuer of the response. Always
https://accounts.google.com or accounts.google.com for Google ID tokens.

fields.name: at_hash
fields.description:
Access token hash. Provides validation that the access token is tied to the
identity token. If the ID token is issued with an access token in the
server flow, this is always included. This can be used as an alternate
mechanism to protect against cross-site request forgery attacks, but if you
follow Step 1 and Step 3 it is not necessary to verify the access token.

fields.name: email_verified
fields.description: True if the user's e-mail address has been verified; otherwise false.

fields.name: sub
fields.description:
An identifier for the user, unique among all Google accounts and never
reused. A Google account can have multiple emails at different points in
time, but the sub value is never changed. Use sub within your application
as the unique-identifier key for the user.

fields.name: azp
fields.description:
The client_id of the authorized presenter. This claim is only needed when
the party requesting the ID token is not the same as the audience of the ID
token. This may be the case at Google for hybrid apps where a web
application and Android app have a different client_id but share the same
project.

fields.name: email
fields.description:
The user's email address. This may not be unique and is not suitable for
use as a primary key. Provided only if your scope included the string
"email".

fields.name: profile
fields.description:
The URL of the user's profile page. Might be provided when:
- The request scope included the string "profile"
- The ID token is returned from a token refresh
- When profile claims are present, you can use them to update your app's
user records. Note that this claim is never guaranteed to be present.

fields.name: picture
fields.description:
The URL of the user's profile picture. Might be provided when:
- The request scope included the string "profile"
- The ID token is returned from a token refresh
- When picture claims are present, you can use them to update your app's
user records. Note that this claim is never guaranteed to be present.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The user's full name, in a displayable form. Might be provided when:
- The request scope included the string "profile"
- The ID token is returned from a token refresh
- When name claims are present, you can use them to update your app's user
records. Note that this claim is never guaranteed to be present.

fields.name: given_name
fields.description:
The user's given name, in a displayable form. Might be provided when:
- The request scope included the string "profile"
- The ID token is returned from a token refresh
- When name claims are present, you can use them to update your app's user
records. Note that this claim is never guaranteed to be present.

fields.name: family_name
fields.description:
The user's family name, in a displayable form. Might be provided when:
- The request scope included the string "profile"
- The ID token is returned from a token refresh
- When name claims are present, you can use them to update your app's user
records. Note that this claim is never guaranteed to be present.

fields.name: aud
fields.description:
Identifies the audience that this ID token is intended for. It must be one
of the OAuth 2.0 client IDs of your application.

fields.name: iat
fields.description: The time the ID token was issued, represented in Unix time (integer seconds).

fields.name: exp
fields.description: The time the ID token expires, represented in Unix time (integer seconds).

fields.name: nonce
fields.description:
The value of the nonce supplied by your app in the authentication request.
You should enforce protection against replay attacks by ensuring it is
presented only once.

fields.name: hd
fields.description:
The hosted G Suite domain of the user. Provided only if the user belongs to
a hosted domain.

fields.name: locale
fields.description:
The user's locale, represented by a BCP 47 language tag.
Might be provided when a name claim is present.

fields.name: sub
fields.description: the value is the unique identifier for the user

fields.name: aud
fields.description: the value is the client_id from your developer account

fields.name: iat
fields.description: number of seconds since Epoch, in UTC

fields.name: exp
fields.description: number of seconds since Epoch, in UTC

fields.description: The value can either be a String (”true”) or a Boolean (true).

fields.description: The value can either be a String (”true”) or a Boolean (true).

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
